body:
Regarding the above abnormal information, the local test also adds that sniff startup and call are normal, and the above error will appear during the APP application closing process.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2892433/82524458-901a5800-9b61-11ea-9771-de155ec27ef8.png)

At the same time, it is also tested that when the SW plugin interception is not added, the startup and call are normal, and the following exception will also occur during the APP closing process.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2892433/82524506-b8a25200-9b61-11ea-9d37-7422f13c7f47.png)

Based on the above analysis, it is judged that the shutdown abnormality has nothing to do with the SK interception plugin. It may be related to the timing sniff detection mechanism of the ES itself, which will continue to be executed when the application is closed. Maybe you can try this direction.

This plugin is to filter the segment's first span. You need to make sure whether it is matched. Please try to debug locally. Once the `Lettuce/ is successful` works, I would not say this is a code level issue.

FYI, the new UI, @Fine0830 is working. We should have a version to test tomorrow.

I will sync to the whole community about the progress.
1.这个endpoint只有一个span，2我是全名称匹配，没有使用正则之类的

English only. And still, local debug is much better than you ask here. At least you have more detail, we could do a more meaningful discussion.

Asking me to guess has not much meaning, and is not very helpful for you.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12554451/82531760-877e4d80-9b72-11ea-9f79-81499050daeb.png)
I modified the code to print all endpoints, but I didn't see ‘/actuator/health‘ in the log, but this endpoint was included on the page

Have been located and fixed in the master branch. 

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/a10e04493272a88931d6916662b30d0a320287bb/oap-server/server-receiver-plugin/skywalking-trace-receiver-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/receiver/trace/provider/parser/listener/MultiScopesAnalysisListener.java#L229-L238

org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.trace.ignore.TraceIgnoreExtendService
this is the class i modified

That means,  ‘/actuator/health‘ isn't the one creating the segment. Suggest you consider other plugin works first, such as Tomcat container, jetty plugin, etc. 

The name showing in the segment doesn't mean it is the first span. EntrySpan has an operation name override mechanism.

Look closer and dig deeper.
thanks， I make an attempt
thanks for all  developers

Analysis trace from zipkin or jaeger is not a high performance. We only have experimental Zipkin trace analysis. It is only working in no cluster mode. 

see #2653 for more details and context. Jaeger and Zipkin are sharing the same issue.
Thanks for your reply！

Two things,

1. Segment in the preparation stage before sending to the backend, it causes more resources(memory and CPU) and when sending happens, more network used.

How to Fix it

@dmsolr `UITemplateManagementDAOImpl` is empty, and `org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.storage.plugin.influxdb.base.ManagementDAO` is added but not tested.

The `IManagementDAO` DAOs are all not tested, they would be used in the templated initialization stage. When the OAP starts up and reboots, if the templates in the `ui-templates.yaml`, but don't exist in the storage, the OAP(leader node) would inject those automatically. **Notice, I haven't implemented this yet, but will do in this PR**.

```graphql
query {

    name,
    type
    configuration,
    activated,

}
```
